author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: ‘Halloween II’ at the opera house
text:
‘Halloween II’ at the opera house Oct 26, 2015 Halloween night at the Haddonfield Clinic is more tricks than treats in “Halloween II.” 
Camden — Jamie Lee Curtis’ local family will host a screening of the 1981 sequel to her horror film classic on Halloween night. “Halloween II” will be shown at 8 p.m. at the Camden Opera House, Elm Street/Route 1. 
Set on Oct. 31, 1978, “Halloween II” follows the events of the first film, where the little town of Haddonfield experienced the murderous rampage of mental institution escapee Michael Myers (stuntman Dick Warlock). Student Laurie Strode (Curtis) is in the Haddonfield Clinic as Dr. Loomis (Donald Pleasence) and the Haddonfield police search the town looking for Michael who, upon hearing that Laurie is still alive, makes his way to the clinic and starts to murder the small clinic's staff in an attempt to get to her. 
Tickets will bee $9 at the door, cash or check. The R-rated movie runs 92 minutes. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
